TITLE: Arduino Sketch for Publishing Sensor Data via MQTT
DESCRIPTION: This Arduino sketch uses the Ethernet shield and PubSubClient library to publish sensor data to an MQTT broker. It reads values from an analog sensor and sends them to Home Assistant at regular intervals.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_posts/2015-09-11-different-ways-to-use-mqtt-with-home-assistant.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: c
CODE:
```
/*
  This sketch is based on the basic MQTT example by
  http://knolleary.github.io/pubsubclient/
*/

#include <SPI.h>
#include <Ethernet.h>
#include <PubSubClient.h>

#define DEBUG 1 // Debug output to serial console

// Device settings
IPAddress deviceIp(192, 168, 0, 43);
byte deviceMac[] = { 0xAB, 0xCD, 0xFE, 0xFE, 0xFE, 0xFE };
char* deviceId  = "sensor01"; // Name of the sensor
char* stateTopic = "home-assistant/sensor01/brightness"; // MQTT topic where values are published
int sensorPin = A0; // Pin to which the sensor is connected to
char buf[4]; // Buffer to store the sensor value
int updateInterval = 1000; // Interval in milliseconds

// MQTT server settings
IPAddress mqttServer(192, 168, 0, 12);
int mqttPort = 1883;

EthernetClient ethClient;
PubSubClient client(ethClient);

void reconnect() {
  while (!client.connected()) {
#if DEBUG
    Serial.print("Attempting MQTT connection...");
#endif
    if (client.connect(deviceId)) {
#if DEBUG
      Serial.println("connected");
#endif
    } else {
#if DEBUG
      Serial.print("failed, rc=");
      Serial.print(client.state());
      Serial.println(" try again in 5 seconds");
#endif
      delay(5000);
    }
  }
}

void setup() {
  Serial.begin(57600);
  client.setServer(mqttServer, mqttPort);
  Ethernet.begin(deviceMac, deviceIp);
  delay(1500);
}

void loop() {
  if (!client.connected()) {
    reconnect();
  }
  client.loop();

  int sensorValue = analogRead(sensorPin);
#if DEBUG
  Serial.print("Sensor value: ");
  Serial.println(sensorValue);
#endif
  client.publish(stateTopic, itoa(sensorValue, buf, 10));
  delay(updateInterval);
}
```

TITLE: Configuring a Bayesian Binary Sensor
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet configures a Bayesian binary sensor named 'Heat On' utilizing both numeric and state observation platforms in Home Assistant. Dependencies include the Home Assistant platform with the Bayesian integration enabled. This configuration sets prior probabilities and thresholds to determine the sensor's state based on various conditions. Proper setup is critical as misuse may lead to performance degradation or errors in future versions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_posts/2022-10-05-release-202210.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
binary_sensor:
  - name: "Heat On"
    platform: bayesian
    prior: 0.2
    probability_threshold: 0.9
    observations:
      - platform: numeric_state
        entity_id: sensor.outside_air_temperature_fahrenheit
        prob_given_true: 0.95
        prob_given_false: 0.05
        below: 50
      - platform: numeric_state # line no longer needed - delete
        entity_id: sensor.outside_air_temperature_fahrenheit # line no longer needed - delete
        prob_given_true: 0.05 # line no longer needed - delete
        prob_given_false: 0.95 # line no longer needed - delete
        above: 50 # no longer needed - delete
      - platform: state
        entity_id: binary_sensor.house_occupied
        prob_given_true: 0.3
        prob_given_false: 0.05
        to_state: "on"
      - platform: state # line no longer needed - delete
        entity_id: binary_sensor.house_occupied # line no longer needed - delete
        prob_given_true: 0.7 # line no longer needed - delete
        prob_given_false: 0.95 # line no longer needed - delete
        to_state: "off" # line no longer needed - delete
```

TITLE: Configuring REST Command and Automation in Home Assistant (YAML)
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet configures a REST command and an automation in Home Assistant to periodically send an HTTP GET request to the HTTP to MQTT bridge's `/keep_alive/` endpoint. This prevents the Heroku app from going to sleep due to inactivity, ensuring quicker response times. The automation is triggered every 10 minutes between 7:30 AM and 11:59 PM.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_posts/2017-03-28-http-to-mqtt-bridge.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
rest_command:
  http_to_mqtt_keep_alive:
    url: https://<your_app_address>/keep_alive/
    method: get

automation:
  alias: "HTTP to MQTT keep alive"
  trigger:
    platform: time_pattern
    minutes: "/10"
  condition:
    condition: time
    after: "7:30:00"
    before: "23:59:59"
  action:
    service: rest_command.http_to_mqtt_keep_alive
```

| `rate` | yes | Number that represents the time (in seconds) the light should take to transition to the new state. See section on "Rate Transition Time" for how this time value is interpreted.

TITLE: Generating SHA256 Hash for JVC Projector Password
DESCRIPTION: This snippet outlines the steps required to hash a password for newer JVC Projector models (NZ800 and NZ900) before integrating with Home Assistant. The integration necessitates a password that has been hashed to enhance security on the network port. The steps include setting a password, appending a specific string, generating a SHA256 hash, and using the hash for integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_integrations/jvc_projector.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
1. Set a password in the projector (for example, "1234567890").
2. Append the string "JVCKWPJ" to your password (for example, "1234567890JVCKWPJ").
3. Generate a SHA256 hash of the resulting string using an online tool like [SHA256 Hash Generator](https://emn178.github.io/online-tools/sha256.html).
4. Use the generated hash as the password when adding the JVC Projector integration in Home Assistant.
```

TITLE: Shelly Event Emission Script Example
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript function that handles input events from Shelly devices and emits events accordingly. Useful for triggering automations based on input changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_integrations/shelly.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Example shelly script
function eventHandler(event, userdata) {
  if (
    typeof event.component === "string" &&
    event.component.substring(0, 5) === "input"
  ) {
    let id = Number(event.component.substring(6));
    Shelly.emitEvent("input_event", { id: id });
  }
}
Shelly.addEventHandler(eventHandler);
```

  to: playing
conditions:
- condition: state
  entity_id: media_player.android_tv
  attribute: app_id
  state: com.netflix.ninja
actions:
- action: button.press
  target:
    entity_id: button.pyload_abort_all_running_downloads

TITLE: Querying Sensor Entity IDs in SQL
DESCRIPTION: This SQL query retrieves the entity IDs from the `states` table, counts their occurrences, and orders them in descending order based on the count. It limits the results to the top 10 most frequent entity IDs, which helps identify sensors with multiple data points.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_integrations/onewire.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT entity_id, COUNT(*) as count FROM states GROUP BY entity_id ORDER BY count DESC LIMIT 10;
```

# Define input_select
input_select:
  thermostat_mode:
    name: Thermostat Mode
    options:
      - "auto"
      - "off"
      - "cool"
      - "heat"
    icon: mdi:target

# Automation.     
 # This automation script runs when a value is received via MQTT on retained topic: thermostatMode
 # It sets the value selector on the GUI. This selector also had its own automation when the value is changed.
- alias: "Set Thermostat Mode Selector"
  triggers:
    - trigger: mqtt
      topic: "thermostatMode"
   # entity_id: input_select.thermostat_mode
  actions:
    - action: input_select.select_option
      target:
        entity_id: input_select.thermostat_mode
      data:
        option: "{{ trigger.payload }}"

 # This automation script runs when the thermostat mode selector is changed.
 # It publishes its value to the same MQTT topic it is also subscribed to.
- alias: "Set Thermostat Mode"
  triggers:
    - trigger: state
      entity_id: input_select.thermostat_mode
  actions:
    - action: mqtt.publish
      data:
        topic: "thermostatMode"
        retain: true
        payload: "{{ states('input_select.thermostat_mode') }}"
```

This action allows you to enable or disable the "Continuous Mode" feature of Nuki Openers. TITLE: Flash Warning Light Automation in AppDaemon - Python
DESCRIPTION: This script extends the basic motion light example by adding a flashing warning light feature. Upon motion detection, a light is turned on and a countdown to turn it off begins. Simultaneously, another light is toggled on and off every second for 10 iterations as a warning signal. Dependencies include the appapi module. Key parameters involve the motion sensor and light entities, along with a count limit for flashing lights. The script demonstrates advanced use of timers and state listening in AppDaemon.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_posts/2016-08-16-we-have-apps-now.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
import appapi

class FlashyMotionLights(appapi.AppDaemon):

  def initialize(self):
    self.listen_state(self.motion, "binary_sensor.drive", new = "on")

  def motion(self, entity, attribute, old, new, kwargs):
    if self.self.sun_down():
      self.turn_on("light.drive")
      self.run_in(self.light_off, 60)
      self.flashcount = 0
      self.run_in(self.flash_warning, 1)

  def light_off(self, kwargs):
    self.turn_off("light.drive")

  def flash_warning(self, kwargs):
    self.toggle("light.living_room")
    self.flashcount += 1
    if self.flashcount < 10:
      self.run_in(self.flash_warning, 1)

```

TITLE: PHP Webhook for Facebook Messenger User ID Retrieval
DESCRIPTION: PHP script that creates a webhook for Facebook Messenger to retrieve user-specific page IDs. The script responds to the message 'get my id' with the user's Facebook page-specific ID.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_integrations/facebook.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php

$access_token = "";
$verify_token = "";

if (isset($_REQUEST['hub_challenge'])) {
    $challenge        = $_REQUEST['hub_challenge'];
    $hub_verify_token = $_REQUEST['hub_verify_token'];

    if ($hub_verify_token === $verify_token) {
        echo $challenge;
    }
}

$input   = json_decode(file_get_contents('php://input'), true);
$sender  = $input['entry'][0]['messaging'][0]['sender']['id'];
$message = $input['entry'][0]['messaging'][0]['message']['text'];

if (preg_match('/get my id/', strtolower($message))) {
    $url      = 'https://graph.facebook.com/v2.10/me/messages?access_token=' . $access_token;
    $ch       = curl_init($url);
    $jsonData = '{
        "recipient":{
            "id":"' . $sender . '"
        },
        "message":{
            "text":"Your ID: ' . $sender . '"
        }
      }';

    $jsonDataEncoded = $jsonData;
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, 1);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $jsonDataEncoded);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, ['Content-Type: application/json']);

    if (!empty($input['entry'][0]['messaging'][0]['message'])) {
        $result = curl_exec($ch);
    }
}

```

TITLE: Gathering SSL Certificate from Router
DESCRIPTION: This bash command is used to extract the SSL certificate from a router. It uses `openssl` to connect to the router, retrieve the certificate chain, and then extract the router's certificate in PEM format, saving it to the `router_cert.pem` file. This certificate can then be used for SSL verification in Home Assistant.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_integrations/tomato.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```

```

TITLE: Pausing Downloads with Low Disk Space in YAML
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet configures an automation to pause new downloads when available disk space falls below 5 GB. It utilizes a numeric state trigger on the 'sensor.pyload_free_space' entity and executes an action to turn off the 'switch.pyload_pause_resume_queue'. Requires Home Assistant with the pyLoad integration and proper configuration of entities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_integrations/pyload.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
alias: "Monitor pyLoad download queue"
description: "Pause new downloads when the disk space is low."
triggers:
  - trigger: numeric_state
    entity_id: sensor.pyload_free_space
    below: 5000000000  # Trigger when free space drops below 5 GB (in bytes)
actions:
  - action: switch.turn_off
    target:
      entity_id: switch.pyload_pause_resume_queue
  - service: notify.persistent_notification
    data:
      message: "Free space is low, pausing pyLoad queue."
mode: single
```

TITLE: Terminal Commands for I2C Configuration

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
mkdir /tmp/mnt
mount /dev/sda1 /tmp/mnt
mkdir -p /tmp/mnt/modules
echo -ne i2c-dev>/tmp/mnt/modules/rpi-i2c.conf

sync
reboot
```

TITLE: Arduino Code for Reading Sensors (C)
DESCRIPTION: This C code sketch is for Arduino devices, configuring it to read temperature and humidity from analog pins, format the data as JSON, and send it over the serial port.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_integrations/serial.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: C
CODE:
```
#include <ArduinoJson.h>

void setup() {
  Serial.begin(115200);
}

void loop() {
  StaticJsonDocument<100> jsonBuffer;

  jsonBuffer["temperature"] = analogRead(A0);
  jsonBuffer["humidity"] = analogRead(A1);

  serializeJson(jsonBuffer, Serial);
  Serial.println();
  
  delay(1000);
}
```

    platform: bayesian
    prior: 0.2
    probability_threshold: 0.9
    observations:
      - platform: state
        entity_id: binary_sensor.house_occupied
        prob_given_true: 0.3
        prob_given_false: 0.05
        to_state: "on"
      - platform: state # not 
        entity_id: binary_sensor.house_occupied # not recommended

document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function () {
	registerNiceSelect();
	registerLanguageSelectChange();
});

	languageSelect = NiceSelect.bind(
		document.querySelector("select#language-select"),
		{ searchable: true }
	);
}

function registerLanguageSelectChange() {
	const browserLocale = navigator.language || navigator.userLanguage;

	updateLanguageSupports(browserLocale);

	document

			updateLanguageSupports(e.target.value);
		});
}

TITLE: Lua Script for Pushed Updates from Netio Devices
DESCRIPTION: This Lua script sends socket and consumption status updates via CGI to a specified address. It should be added to the device interface as an action triggered on "Netio" "System variables updated" with an 'Always' schedule.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_integrations/netio.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
-- this will send socket and consumption status updates via CGI
-- to given address. Associate with 'System variables update' event
-- to get consumption updates when they show up

local address='ha:8123'
local path = '/api/netio/<host>'


local output = {}
for i = 1, 4 do for _, what in pairs({'state', 'consumption',
                        'cumulatedConsumption', 'consumptionStart'}) do
    local varname = string.format('output%d_%s', i, what)
    table.insert(output,
        varname..'='..tostring(devices.system[varname]):gsub(" ","|"))
end end

local qs = table.concat(output, '&')
local url = string.format('http://%s%s?%s', address, path, qs)
devices.system.CustomCGI{url=url}
```

TITLE: Configuring MQTT Lock in YAML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to fully configure an MQTT lock using YAML within Home Assistant. It specifies the lock's name, state, command topics, and payloads along with setting optimistic state handling and message retention. The YAML configuration requires that the Home Assistant environment is properly set up with MQTT support.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_integrations/lock.mqtt.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
# Example configuration.yaml entry
mqtt:
  - lock:
      name: Frontdoor
      state_topic: "home-assistant/frontdoor/state"
      code_format: "^\\d{4}$"
      command_topic: "home-assistant/frontdoor/set"
      command_template: '{ "action": "{{ value }}", "code":"{{ code }}" }'
      payload_lock: "LOCK"
      payload_unlock: "UNLOCK"
      state_locked: "LOCK"
      state_unlocked: "UNLOCK"
      state_locking: "LOCKING"
      state_unlocking: "UNLOCKING"
      state_jammed: "MOTOR_JAMMED"
      state_ok: "MOTOR_OK"
      optimistic: false
      qos: 1
      retain: true
      value_template: "{{ value.x }}"
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_posts/2016-05-26-ibeacons-how-to-track-things-that-cant-track-themselves-part-ii.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_1

CODE:

automation:
  - alias: "Forgotten keys"
    trigger:
      platform: template
      value_template: '{{ states.device_tracker.greg_gregphone.state != states.device_tracker.beacon_keys.state}}'
    condition:
      condition: template
      value_template: '{{ states.device_tracker.greg_gregphone.state != "home" }}'
    action:
      service: script.turn_on
      target:
        entity_id: script.send_key_alert

  - alias: "Forgotten keys - cancel"
    trigger:
      platform: template
      value_template: '{{ states.device_tracker.greg_gregphone.state == states.device_tracker.beacon_keys.state }}'
    condition:
      - condition: state
        entity_id: script.send_key_alert

      target:
        entity_id: script.send_key_alert
```

TITLE: Creating a Template Sensor for IMAP Events - YAML
DESCRIPTION: This YAML code snippet demonstrates how to create a template sensor that triggers on IMAP events. It extracts various attributes from the event data, such as subject, sender, and message text, which can be used in automations.

"template:\n  - trigger:\n      - trigger: event\n        event_type: \"imap_content\"\n        id: \"custom_event\"\n    sensor:\n      - name: imap_content\n        state: \"{{ trigger.event.data['subject'] }}\"\n        attributes:\n          Entry: \"{{ trigger.event.data['entry_id'] }}\"\n          UID: \"{{ trigger.event.data['uid'] }}\"\n          Message: \"{{ trigger.event.data['text'] }}\"\n          Server: \"{{ trigger.event.data['server'] }}\"\n          Username: \"{{ trigger.event.data['username'] }}\"\n          Search: \"{{ trigger.event.data['search'] }}\"\n          Folder: \"{{ trigger.event.data['folder'] }}\"\n          Sender: \"{{ trigger.event.data['sender'] }}\"\n          Date: \"{{ trigger.event.data['date'] }}\"\n          Subject: \"{{ trigger.event.data['subject'] }}\"\n          Initial: \"{{ trigger.event.data['initial'] }}\"\n          To: \"{{ trigger.event.data['headers'].get('Delivered-To', ['n/a'])[0] }}\"\n          Return-Path: \"{{ trigger.event.data['headers'].get('Return-Path',['n/a'])[0] }}\"\n          Received-first: \"{{ trigger.event.data['headers'].get('Received',['n/a'])[0] }}\"\n          Received-last: \"{{ trigger.event.data['headers'].get('Received',['n/a'])[-1] }}\""

TITLE: Rendering Language Support Cards in JavaScript for Home Assistant Assist
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet handles the rendering of language support cards for Home Assistant Assist. It updates the UI based on the selected language, matches partial locales, and sets the support state for each card element.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/voice_control/index.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
let elems = document.querySelectorAll(".supported-cards .supported-card");
if (!elems) return;

let supports = data[locale];
let foundLocale = locale;
if (!supports) {
	Object.keys(data).forEach((key) => {
		if (key.split("-")[0] === locale.split("-")[0]) {
			supports = data[key];
			foundLocale = key;
		}
	});
}
if (!supports) return;

document.querySelector("#language-select").value = foundLocale;
languageSelect.update();

elems.forEach((elem) => elem.setAttribute("data-state", "-1"));

elems.forEach((elem, index) => {
	// set data-state to the value of the value
	elem.setAttribute("data-state", supports[index]);
});
```

TITLE: Automating Light Control with ISY Control Events in Home Assistant
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to automate light control based on ISY control events in Home Assistant. It includes a YAML automation configuration that listens for the `isy994_control` event. When a specific control event, like a double tap ('DFON'), is detected on a specified entity, it triggers actions to turn off a different light. The configuration requires entity IDs within Home Assistant and knowledge of ISY control event types.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_integrations/isy994.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
automation:
  - alias: "turn off living room on double tap lightswitch"
    triggers:
      - trigger: event
        event_type: isy994_control
        event_data:
          entity_id: light.lr_track_lights_front
          control: "DFON"
          value: 255
          formatted: "On"
          uom: "100"
          prec: "0"
    actions:
      - action: light.turn_off
        target:
          entity_id: light.lr_track_lights_rear
```

TITLE: Configuring Filter Sensor
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet demonstrates configuring a filter sensor in Home Assistant, applying outlier and low-pass filters to data from another sensor. Dependencies include having a pre-existing sensor entity to be filtered. The key parameters include 'entity_id' for the sensor to read, and 'filters' for specifying filtering algorithms and respective settings. Inputs are sensor data, with filtered sensor data as output.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_posts/2018-03-09-release-65.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
sensor:
  - platform: filter
    name: "filtered realistic humidity"
    entity_id: sensor.realistic_humidity
    filters:
      - filter: outlier
        window_size: 4
        radius: 4.0
      - filter: lowpass
        time_constant: 10
        precision: 2
```

TITLE: Dynamic Icon based on Switch State
DESCRIPTION: Creates a command line switch that changes its icon based on its current state. Uses templates to determine which icon to display based on the JSON response.

CODE:

command_line:
  - switch:
      name: Driveway outside sensor
      command_on: >
        curl -X PUT -d '{"on":true}' "http://ip_address/api/sensors/27/config/"
      command_off: >
        curl -X PUT -d '{"on":false}' "http://ip_address/api/sensors/27/config/"
      command_state: curl http://ip_address/api/sensors/27/
      value_template: >
        {{value_json.config.on}}
      icon: >
        {% if value_json.config.on == true %} mdi:toggle-switch
        {% else %} mdi:toggle-switch-off
        {% endif %}
```

TITLE: Creating udev Rules for Energenie USB Devices
DESCRIPTION: This command sequence creates an udev rule that grants proper access permissions to the Energenie USB device, then reloads rules and triggers them. The example uses vendor ID 04b4 and product ID fd15 specific to Energenie devices.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_integrations/energenie_power_sockets.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo echo 'SUBSYSTEM=="usb", ATTR{idVendor}=="04b4", ATTR{idProduct}=="fd15", MODE="0666"' > /lib/udev/rules.d/60-energenie-usb.rules
sudo udevadm control --reload-rules
sudo udevadm trigger
```

TITLE: Select Next Option in Home Assistant with YAML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the `select.select_next` action in a Home Assistant automation or script using YAML. It changes the selected option to the next available option in the list. It requires the `entity_id` of the target select entity and defaults to cycling back to the first option if the current option is the last one.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_integrations/select.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml

TITLE: Automating Media Playback with Tag Scans in Home Assistant
DESCRIPTION: This YAML code snippet demonstrates how to automate media playback using NFC tag scans in Home Assistant. It defines an automation that triggers when a tag is scanned, checks if the scanned tag and device are supported, and then plays media based on the tag ID and device ID. This requires Home Assistant 0.115 or later to support the new automation features.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_posts/2020-09-15-home-assistant-tags.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
"# Note, this is using new automation features introduced in Home Assistant 0.115
automation:
- id: handle_tag_scan
  alias: \"Handle Tag Scan\"
  mode: single
  # Hide warnings when triggered while in delay.
  max_exceeded: silent
  variables:
    # Map scanner device ID to media player entity ID
    media_players:
      0e19cd3cf2b311ea88f469a7512c307d: media_player.spotify_balloob
    # Map tag ID to content
    tags:
      A7-6B-90-5F:
        media_content_id: spotify:album:0h2knr6qpiAq0tV5ri5JMF
        media_content_type: album
      04-B1-C6-62-2F-64-80:
        media_content_id: spotify:playlist:0OtWh3u6fZrBJTQtVBQWge
        media_content_type: playlist
  trigger:
    platform: event
    event_type: tag_scanned
  condition:
    # Test that we support this device and tag
    - \"{{ trigger.event.data.tag_id in tags }}\"
    - \"{{ trigger.event.data.device_id in media_players }}\"
  action:
    - variables:
        media_player_entity_id: \"{{ media_players[trigger.event.data.device_id] }}\"
        media_content_id: \"{{ tags[trigger.event.data.tag_id].media_content_id }}\"
        media_content_type: \"{{ tags[trigger.event.data.tag_id].media_content_type }}\"
    - service: media_player.play_media
      target:
        entity_id: \"{{ media_player_entity_id }}\"
      data:
        media_content_id: \"{{ media_content_id }}\"
        media_content_type: \"{{ media_content_type }}\"
    - delay: 2 # timeout before we allow processing next scan"
```

TITLE: RESTful Sensor with signal-api-receiver
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet configures a RESTful sensor using `signal-api-receiver`. It defines the resource URL and extracts the message content and sender information using `value_template` and `json_attributes`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_integrations/signal_messenger.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
```yaml
- resource: "http://127.0.0.1:8105/receive/pop"
  sensor:
    - name: "Signal message received"
      value_template: >
        {{ value_json['envelope']['dataMessage']['message'] }}
      json_attributes_path: envelope
      json_attributes:
        - source
        - sourceNumber
        - sourceUuid
        - sourceDevice
        - timestamp
```
```

TITLE: MQTT Event Processing with Value Template
DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet shows how to use a value template to process MQTT event data. It listens to a specific MQTT topic (`desk/button/state`), extracts the button name and action from the JSON payload, and sets the `button` attribute and `event_type` accordingly. Empty dictionaries within the payload will be ignored.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_integrations/event.mqtt.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
"mqtt:\n  - event:\n      name: \"Desk button\"\n      state_topic: \"desk/button/state\"\n      event_types:\n        - single\n        - double\n      device_class: \"button\"\n      value_template: |\n        { {% for key in value_json %}\n        {% if value_json[key].get(\"Action\") %}\n        \"button\": \"{{ key }}\",\n        \"event_type\": \"{{ value_json[key].Action | lower }}\"\n        {% endif %}\n        {% endfor %} }\n"
```

TITLE: Configuring Automation for Acaia Scale Timer Control in Home Assistant
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for automatically taring the scale, resetting and starting the timer when a brew starts on a connected coffee machine. Uses state triggers and button press actions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_integrations/acaia.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
alias: "Start timer on scale"
description: "When a brew starts on the machine, the following actions are started: tare, reset the timer, and start the timer on the scale."
triggers:
  - trigger: state
    entity_id:
      - binary_sensor.lm001234_brewing_active
    to: "on"
    from: "off"
actions:
  - action: button.press
    target:
      entity_id: button.lunar_tare
  - action: button.press
    target:
      entity_id:
        - button.lunar_reset_timer
  - action: button.press
    target:
      entity_id:
        - button.lunar_start_stop_timer
```

TITLE: Filtering Single Entity with Multiple State Filters in Home Assistant
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to apply multiple state filters to a single entity and how to filter an entity based on its attribute. It filters `sensor.water_leak` and `sensor.outside_temp` based on the state being "on" or above 90, and `sensor.humidity_and_temp` based on the `humidity` attribute being above 50. The example shows a combined filtering approach using both state and attribute values with operators.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/dashboards/badges.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
```yaml
type: entity-filter
state_filter:
  - "on"
  - operator: ">"
    value: 90
entities:
  - sensor.water_leak
  - sensor.outside_temp
  - entity: sensor.humidity_and_temp
    state_filter:
      - operator: ">"
        value: 50
        attribute: humidity
```
```

    alarm_chime:
      friendly_name: Chime

      turn_on:
        - condition: state
          entity_id: alarm_control_panel.alarm_panel
          attribute: chime
          state: False
        - action: alarmdecoder.alarm_toggle_chime
          target:
            entity_id: alarm_control_panel.alarm_panel
          data:
            code: !secret alarm_code

        - condition: state
          entity_id: alarm_control_panel.alarm_panel
          attribute: chime
          state: True
        - action: alarmdecoder.alarm_toggle_chime
          target:
            entity_id: alarm_control_panel.alarm_panel
          data:
            code: !secret alarm_code
      icon_template: >
        {% if is_state_attr('alarm_control_panel.alarm_panel', 'chime', true) %}

        {% else %}

TITLE: Retrieving Container Cleaning Schedule - YAML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure a scrape sensor to retrieve information about container types and cleaning dates through a POST request, including parameters to specify in the payload.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_integrations/scrape.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
# Example configuration.yaml entry. Change postal code and house number to your own address.
scrape:
  - resource: https://crm.cleanprofs.nl/search/planning
    method: POST
    payload: zipcode=5624JW&street_number=17
    headers:
      Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
    sensor:
      - name: "Type container 1"
        select: "div.nk-tb-item:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(1) > span:nth-child(1)"
      - name: "Date container 1"
        select: "div.nk-tb-item:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(3) > span:nth-child(1) > span:nth-child(1)"
      - name: "Type container 2"
        select: "div.nk-tb-item:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(1) > span:nth-child(1)"
      - name: "Date container 2"
        select: "div.nk-tb-item:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(3) > span:nth-child(1) > span:nth-child(1)"
```

TITLE: MQTT Fan Configuration in YAML
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet shows an example configuration for an MQTT fan in Home Assistant.  It includes settings for state, command, and availability topics, as well as payload definitions for on/off states.
SOURCE: https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/blob/current/source/_posts/2020-02-05-release-105.markdown#2025-04-19_snippet_5

CODE:
```
  "fan:\n    - platform: mqtt\n      name: \"room2\"\n      state_topic: \"stat/bvent/POWER\"\n      command_topic: \"cmnd/bvent/POWER\"\n      availability_topic: \"tele/bvent/LWT\"\n      payload_available: \"Online\"\n      payload_not_available: \"Offline\"\n      payload_on: \"ON\"\n      payload_off: \"OFF\"\n      qos: 1\n      retain: false\n      optimistic: false\n  "
```
